content.markup: This generally happens when your distribution has unprivileged user namespaces disabled, or your Flatpak version is older than 1.8.
content.header: Enabling unprivileged user namespaces on Debian-based distros
content.markup: If the distro you are currently using is Debian or a derivative (Ubuntu, Mint, etc), you can run the following commands as root (you can enter a root shell via <tt>sudo -i</tt>):
content.code: sudo dpkg-statoverride --update --add root root 0755 /usr/bin/bwrap echo kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=1 | sudo tee /etc/sysctl.d/50-bubblewrap.conf sudo sysctl -w kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=1
content.header: Enabling unprivileged user namespaces on other distros
content.markup: If you installed a "hardened" security kernel, these also usually disable unprivileged user namespaces. They can be re-enabled by running the following as root (you can enter a root shell via <tt>sudo -i</tt>):
content.code: echo kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=1 | sudo tee /etc/sysctl.d/50-bubblewrap.conf sudo sysctl -w kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=1
